item.title: Setup a 'dotfiles' repository in Git
item.description: This post covers the the basic steps to backup and sync your Linux system config files (a.k.a. dotfiles) using a Git bare repository. The process is based on an article I found at Atlassian which goes into much greater detail. To set things up, use the following console commands to create the bare Git repository and add the dotfiles alias. git init --bare $HOME/.dotfiles alias dotfiles='/usr/bin/git --git-dir=$HOME/.dotfiles/ --work-tree=$HOME' dotfiles config --local status.
